medium_description_en: Quantifies both hemodialysis and peritoneal dialysis treatment adequacy.

seo.meta_description_en: The Kt/V quantifies both hemodialysis and peritoneal dialysis treatment adequacy.
seo.keywords_en: Kt/V, Kt gotch, Kt/V gotch, kt/v calc, kt/v calculator, kt/v score, Kt/V dialysis, Kt/V renal, kt/V renal failure, kt/v esrd, kt/v esrf, dialysis calc, dialysis prognosis, prognosis esrd, prognosis esrf, px esrd, px esrf, gotch dialysis calc, gotch prognosis, gotch formula, esrd formula, dialysis treatment adequacy, dialysis tx adequacy

about.formula_en:
Kt/V, where

  • K = dialyzer clearance of urea
  • t = dialysis time
  • V = volume of distribution of urea, approximately equal to patient's total body water
about.more_info_en:
Hemodialysis: Kt/V target is ≥ 1.3, per US National Kidney Foundation.
Peritoneal dialysis: Kt/V target is ≥ 1.7/week.

Original/Primary Reference.text: Gotch FA, Sargent JA. A mechanistic analysis of the National Cooperative Dialysis Study (NCDS). Kidney int. 1985; 28 (3): 526–34. doi:10.1038/ki.1985.160. PMID 3934452.

Validation.text: Bonert M, Saville BA. A non-dimensional analysis of hemodialysis. Open Biomed Eng J 2010; 4: 138–55. doi:10.2174/1874120701004010138. PMC 3111706. PMID 21673980.

Other References.text: Clinical practice guidelines for nutrition in chronic renal failure. K/DOQI, National Kidney Foundation. Am J Kidney Dis 35 (6 Suppl 2): S1–140. 2000.PMID 10895784.

creator_info.about_en: Frank Gotch, MD is an associate professor at the University of California, San Francisco. He is best known for his extensive research in dialysis adequacy, including the development of Kt/V. Dr Gotch's current research interests are primarily concerned with modeling dialysis technology.
